functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have the ability to pull data that feeds six  out of eleven current tableau reports referenced in the file: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EYI07gSrc4Hw9_pwxIGgVXPow7IrKaZW5qeEvy-uiRo/edit?usp=sharing. Eventually solution shall provide ability to eliminate the use of ODS. (The reports specified in the fie are generated from the source systems: workday, slate, sfaq, banner.)

Tableau reports: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EYI07gSrc4Hw9_pwxIGgVXPow7IrKaZW5qeEvy-uiRo/edit?usp=sharing

Are these the six reports: (Hilltop Undergraduate Deposits (Live) - Fall 2022.twb,  Course Assignments by Faculty Type.twbx, Workday Academic Appointment Audit.twbx, CAS Admissions Trends - Summer and Fall.twbx, Prospect and Inquiry Transfer 3 Y to Y Gender, Geomarket, Ethnicity, Major.twbx, SLATE Payments Vs. TBRDEPO Posting.twb)

solution shall have the ability to pull data that feeds six  out of eleven current tableau reports referenced in the file: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1eyi07gsrc4hw9_pwxiggvxpow7irkazw5qeevy-uiro/edit?usp=sharing. eventually solution shall provide ability to eliminate the use of ods. (the reports specified in the fie are generated from the source systems: workday, slate, sfaq, banner.) tableau reports: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1eyi07gsrc4hw9_pwxiggvxpow7irkazw5qeevy-uiro/edit?usp=sharing

are these the six reports: (hilltop undergraduate deposits (live) - fall 2022.twb,  course assignments by faculty type.twbx, workday academic appointment audit.twbx, cas admissions trends - summer and fall.twbx, prospect and inquiry transfer 3 y to y gender, geomarket, ethnicity, major.twbx, slate payments vs. tbrdepo posting.twb)

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have ability to source banner data along with its relationships among objects. This data will be leveraged for reporting per need.
functional_requirements.combined_text: solution shall have ability to source banner data along with its relationships among objects. this data will be leveraged for reporting per need.

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have the ability to pull all Banner data through relevant connection mechanism. The connection mechanism can be either JDBC, JDBC vis ADF and/or Ethos API etc.,
functional_requirements.comments: 8/10: current method is JDBC and we wanted them to stick to it. It can support Ethos API down the road, yet our current method we tested is JDBC via ADF.
functional_requirements.combined_text: solution shall have the ability to pull all banner data through relevant connection mechanism. the connection mechanism can be either jdbc, jdbc vis adf and/or ethos api etc., 8/10: current method is jdbc and we wanted them to stick to it. it can support ethos api down the road, yet our current method we tested is jdbc via adf.

functional_requirements.combined_text: solution shall have ability to source salesforce affinaquest data along with its relationships among objects.

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall replicate and eventually replace current Slate integration into ODS for reporting needs. (Slate - transactional+customer+Nmcustomer) with Snowflake/Azure pipeline. The integration from Slate as a system will not send any data to MDM.
functional_requirements.comments:
SEM - Admissions is the group that runs reports. Aspiration is to generate the reports from the MDM/Snowflake solution.

Jun 11 2022: business runs reports from Banner at present. The integration at present loads data into Banner from slate. Slate constitient are not meant to go into MDM till they are accepted. Unique identifier are returned back to slate from banner post load into banner. 

Integration Loads at present are: (1) Student application information is being loaded from slate into ODS (2) P2P Integration between various systems
Report extracts at present: (1) sfaq into Snowflake ingestion for reporting (to be reviewed during 0B/phase 1)

Open questions: Why was the integration performed the way it was performed?is there a need to join slate and banner information. 

Proposed flow: prospect from slate --> mdm. Banner information --> mdm. MDM cross reference information sent to snowflake providing the relationship to generate reports.

Use cases:
1 - New prospect in slate (s1) --> gets accepted --> loaded into banner (b1) --> unique id generated/loaded back into slate/sfaq/sf-stu --> mdm generated unique id (u1). --> alumni (w1). Snowflake record will be p1. U1 joins with banner, sfaq, workday in addition to the transactional data. The dimensional model will be including all these.

Reporting examples:
- # of registration vs acceptance by time, state, race
functional_requirements.combined_text:
solution shall replicate and eventually replace current slate integration into ods for reporting needs. (slate - transactional+customer+nmcustomer) with snowflake/azure pipeline. the integration from slate as a system will not send any data to mdm. sem - admissions is the group that runs reports. aspiration is to generate the reports from the mdm/snowflake solution.

jun 11 2022: business runs reports from banner at present. the integration at present loads data into banner from slate. slate constitient are not meant to go into mdm till they are accepted. unique identifier are returned back to slate from banner post load into banner. 

integration loads at present are: (1) student application information is being loaded from slate into ods (2) p2p integration between various systems
report extracts at present: (1) sfaq into snowflake ingestion for reporting (to be reviewed during 0b/phase 1)

open questions: why was the integration performed the way it was performed?is there a need to join slate and banner information. 

proposed flow: prospect from slate --> mdm. banner information --> mdm. mdm cross reference information sent to snowflake providing the relationship to generate reports.

use cases:
1 - new prospect in slate (s1) --> gets accepted --> loaded into banner (b1) --> unique id generated/loaded back into slate/sfaq/sf-stu --> mdm generated unique id (u1). --> alumni (w1). snowflake record will be p1. u1 joins with banner, sfaq, workday in addition to the transactional data. the dimensional model will be including all these.

reporting examples:
- # of registration vs acceptance by time, state, race

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have ability to identify unique primary key value for each Address record from each source system. That way updates to existing Address from source will not create a new record in the MDM.

functional_requirements.combined_text: solution shall have ability to identify unique primary key value for each address record from each source system. that way updates to existing address from source will not create a new record in the mdm. 8/16 - question to address, shared with usf:  is there a delete functionality for any of the master and transactional data?

i.e. 1:Many phone, email, etc.

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have ability to display two types(Ex: Home, Work) each for Address, Email and Phone. Solution shall map one or more types from the source systems into a one type value in MDM. Ex: Address types LR, PR, MA from banner source system need to show up as of type 'Home' in MDM. Assumption: The mapping of types from source systems into pipeline/MDM will be finalized before design phase. Assumption: There can be more than one address or email or phone of same type.
functional_requirements.comments:
Reference document that has crosswalk mappings: 
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w8V-sb6oOptz5hxri2ajlWb96Gxom_I59N-PxgrIiOo/edit?usp=sharing
functional_requirements.combined_text:
solution shall have ability to display two types(ex: home, work) each for address, email and phone. solution shall map one or more types from the source systems into a one type value in mdm. ex: address types lr, pr, ma from banner source system need to show up as of type 'home' in mdm. assumption: the mapping of types from source systems into pipeline/mdm will be finalized before design phase. assumption: there can be more than one address or email or phone of same type. reference document that has crosswalk mappings: 
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w8v-sb6ooptz5hxri2ajlwb96gxom_i59n-pxgriioo/edit?usp=sharing

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have the ability to uniquely identify addresses based on Reference 360 service crosswalk defined, the field values provided while associating the address to the constituent.
functional_requirements.combined_text: solution shall have the ability to uniquely identify addresses based on reference 360 service crosswalk defined, the field values provided while associating the address to the constituent.

functional_requirements.description:
While merging, MDM shall have ability to re-parent multiple unique child records of a constituent that are originating from the source systems as per active Constituent role/s. 

Ex: Constituent golden record CG1 has two unique emails. Constituent golden record CG2 has three unqiue emails. CG1 and CG2 are matching and gets merged. Merged golden record MCG12 will have only unique emails. The fields that determine uniqueness on Address, Phone and email will be identified during solutioning/design phase.
functional_requirements.comments:
1:M Use case: Duplcates found among the un-consolidated constituent records loaded into MDM. While merging, records get re-parented. 
Sub use-cases: MDM merge: unique field in field group based, re-parenting
de-duplication during the merge (in MDM, in pipeline)
Reference 360 crosswalks can be leveraged in all the options.
Next steps: USF to update editable version of the architecture with options proposed, LD/USF to brainstorm and conclude 1:M cost effective/centralized requirements.
Proposed decision on Jun 30 2022 is to re-parent. Will connect back to finalize the decision at the right moment.
functional_requirements.combined_text:
while merging, mdm shall have ability to re-parent multiple unique child records of a constituent that are originating from the source systems as per active constituent role/s. 

ex: constituent golden record cg1 has two unique emails. constituent golden record cg2 has three unqiue emails. cg1 and cg2 are matching and gets merged. merged golden record mcg12 will have only unique emails. the fields that determine uniqueness on address, phone and email will be identified during solutioning/design phase. 1:m use case: duplcates found among the un-consolidated constituent records loaded into mdm. while merging, records get re-parented. 
sub use-cases: mdm merge: unique field in field group based, re-parenting
de-duplication during the merge (in mdm, in pipeline)
reference 360 crosswalks can be leveraged in all the options.
next steps: usf to update editable version of the architecture with options proposed, ld/usf to brainstorm and conclude 1:m cost effective/centralized requirements.
proposed decision on jun 30 2022 is to re-parent. will connect back to finalize the decision at the right moment.

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have the ability to identify and survive golden Constituent entity values based on the primary role of matching constituents. Matching constituents will be originating from from different source systems. Each source system will have role information. Addresses and other relevant 1:M child entities to be pulled based on role information into the golden record.
functional_requirements.comments: Primary role hierarchy document: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w8V-sb6oOptz5hxri2ajlWb96Gxom_I59N-PxgrIiOo/edit#gid=619866497
functional_requirements.combined_text: solution shall have the ability to identify and survive golden constituent entity values based on the primary role of matching constituents. matching constituents will be originating from from different source systems. each source system will have role information. addresses and other relevant 1:m child entities to be pulled based on role information into the golden record. primary role hierarchy document: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w8v-sb6ooptz5hxri2ajlwb96gxom_i59n-pxgriioo/edit#gid=619866497

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have the ability to survive a complete Constituent entity record of a source system wihout considering attributes from other systems. The surviving source system shall be determined by the primary role of the Constituent. Except 1:M child entities of the Constituent.
functional_requirements.comments:
MDM Gap: MDM tool at present doesnt have the ability to survive a complete source record where source name determined at run time. Will be addressed by upstream pipeline processing by Snowflake/Azure per discussions among USF, Lumendata, Informatica.

Primary role hierarchy document: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w8V-sb6oOptz5hxri2ajlWb96Gxom_I59N-PxgrIiOo/edit#gid=619866497
functional_requirements.combined_text:
solution shall have the ability to survive a complete constituent entity record of a source system wihout considering attributes from other systems. the surviving source system shall be determined by the primary role of the constituent. except 1:m child entities of the constituent. mdm gap: mdm tool at present doesnt have the ability to survive a complete source record where source name determined at run time. will be addressed by upstream pipeline processing by snowflake/azure per discussions among usf, lumendata, informatica.

primary role hierarchy document: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1w8v-sb6ooptz5hxri2ajlwb96gxom_i59n-pxgriioo/edit#gid=619866497

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall have the ability to exclude access to sensitive data elements from source extraction onwards. (within the Blob and downstream). In special cases of inclusion of sensitive data elements, access to be restricted to only users that have authorization to access them and will include data masking when needed.
functional_requirements.comments:
8/16/22 - From workday, access will be restricted to the blob. Other sources, exclusion of sensitive data while extracting is feasible.
8/10/22 review session notes: Ideally the sensitive data elements to be excluded from Ingestion into Blob/Snowflake/Blob/MDM. If not possible, then access controls per requirements to be in place.
functional_requirements.combined_text:
solution shall have the ability to exclude access to sensitive data elements from source extraction onwards. (within the blob and downstream). in special cases of inclusion of sensitive data elements, access to be restricted to only users that have authorization to access them and will include data masking when needed. 8/16/22 - from workday, access will be restricted to the blob. other sources, exclusion of sensitive data while extracting is feasible.
8/10/22 review session notes: ideally the sensitive data elements to be excluded from ingestion into blob/snowflake/blob/mdm. if not possible, then access controls per requirements to be in place.

functional_requirements.description: Solution shall provide the same data that is provided at present by source API calls. These source API calls are used by business users via visualization tool reports. Ex: Currently business users are invoking Ellucian Banner APIs from Tableau reports. Post deployment of this solution, they shall lhave ability to get the information from the visualization tool itself instead of invoking source APIs.
functional_requirements.comments: 8/4 - UDF/Materialized views/Snowflake queries as relevant to be leveraged to accelerate access to the necessary information.
functional_requirements.combined_text: solution shall provide the same data that is provided at present by source api calls. these source api calls are used by business users via visualization tool reports. ex: currently business users are invoking ellucian banner apis from tableau reports. post deployment of this solution, they shall lhave ability to get the information from the visualization tool itself instead of invoking source apis. 8/4 - udf/materialized views/snowflake queries as relevant to be leveraged to accelerate access to the necessary information.

functional_requirements.description:
Solution shall have ability to provide constituent information(C360 and some transactional information) as close to real-time as possible to IAM system. 

Currently, there are three flows going into IAM system. (1) Realtime flow from Constituent registration (2) 30 minutes job from BEP (Banner Event Publisher) (3) Nightly backup process that augments information from rest of the source systems. Aspiration is to package all three flow information into the near-realtime integration.
functional_requirements.comments: 8/4 - In parellel, Banner integration will be enhanced. Outcome of those efforts will need to be included into this integration.
functional_requirements.combined_text:
solution shall have ability to provide constituent information(c360 and some transactional information) as close to real-time as possible to iam system. 

currently, there are three flows going into iam system. (1) realtime flow from constituent registration (2) 30 minutes job from bep (banner event publisher) (3) nightly backup process that augments information from rest of the source systems. aspiration is to package all three flow information into the near-realtime integration. 8/4 - in parellel, banner integration will be enhanced. outcome of those efforts will need to be included into this integration.

matching_rules.criteria: Match based on standardized address components; may use a unique key from the source system or a composite of address fields.
Match on normalized phone number (country and area code); uniqueness may vary based on business requirements.
Match on lowercased, trimmed email address; not always unique depending on real-world usage.
Use reference/crosswalk tables to link and translate between keys of source and master addresses.

data_quality_rules.approach: Map source values to MDM values via reference data
